[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'bhs', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2018-10-29 04:46:10+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': 'An application developer should care about OpenTracing because it saves them time and energy when connecting the dots between their software dependencies and their Tracer / tracing system.

The new OT registry (:clap: :clap: :clap:, thank you @austinlparker!) is both a valuable tool for the application developer above, and also a nice way to "show rather than tell" about OpenTracing's purpose in the ecosystem. As such, I was thinking that we may want to make it more prominent in the design for opentracing.io per se. Right now we have registry-like elements below the hero area:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2251553/47629766-55257f00-dafa-11e8-862f-4fef1ab6b744.png)

"I Am Not A Designer" so I don't want to be too prescriptive, but I'm curious what others think about adding some basic stats from the registry (e.g., "Search `X` instrumented packages in `Y` languages with support from `Z` tracing systems and vendors") above a fully-functional registry search bar, perhaps as well as a link to the registry landing page.

Thoughts?', 'title': 'Make the OT registry more accessible on the opentracing.io landing page', 'type': 'issue'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'yurishkuro', 'comment_id': 433795001.0, 'datetime': '2018-10-29 05:47:05+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': 'Maybe take inspiration from this home page :-)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3523016/47631450-80b96100-db1c-11e8-810b-9a13838a1160.png)', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}]
column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Make the OT registry more accessible on the opentracing.io landing page
username_0: An application developer should care about OpenTracing because it saves them time and energy when connecting the dots between their software dependencies and their Tracer / tracing system.

The new OT registry (:clap: :clap: :clap:, thank you @austinlparker!) is both a valuable tool for the application developer above, and also a nice way to "show rather than tell" about OpenTracing's purpose in the ecosystem. As such, I was thinking that we may want to make it more prominent in the design for opentracing.io per se. Right now we have registry-like elements below the hero area:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2251553/47629766-55257f00-dafa-11e8-862f-4fef1ab6b744.png)

"I Am Not A Designer" so I don't want to be too prescriptive, but I'm curious what others think about adding some basic stats from the registry (e.g., "Search `X` instrumented packages in `Y` languages with support from `Z` tracing systems and vendors") above a fully-functional registry search bar, perhaps as well as a link to the registry landing page.

Thoughts?
<issue_comment>username_1: Maybe take inspiration from this home page :-)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3523016/47631450-80b96100-db1c-11e8-810b-9a13838a1160.png)

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Uncaught Error: Error from Instagram: The access_token provided is invalid.
username_0: I've got 3 production sties that were using instafeed with out any issues. Until a couple of weeks ago when I now get 'Uncaught Error: Error from Instagram: The access_token provided is invalid.' 

I haven't changed anything and my instagram clients are the same.

http://willpowerfitness.co.uk/
http://botanyblend.com/
<issue_comment>username_1: I think Instagram changed their API on June 1. So until instafeed.js gets updated it probably won't work.
<issue_comment>username_2: Yep same thing.. got this running on a few live sites. Any word on an update?
<issue_comment>username_3: This is nuts. There was a fix for this in the issues, and even that seems to be resetting at the moment. Really could do with this getting fixed.
<issue_comment>username_4: Follow the instructions from to create access token using the correct client id and it should fix the issue

https://www.instagram.com/developer/authentication/
<issue_comment>username_2: This will not work when my app is still in Sandbox mode right? How long does this usually take? (I'm am working on a project from another developer who is not working at my firm anymore.. don't know his app_id en client_id and stuff.. So i had to create a new one)
<issue_comment>username_5: ^ @username_4 's tip works but you'll need to update the client settings so that `https://elfsight.com/service/generate-instagram-access-token/ ` is included in as one of the redirect URLs.
<issue_comment>username_5: Does anyone know if *any* requests still allow the client_id to authenticate? I have yet to find one that didn't auth error without an auth token.
<issue_comment>username_6: I can't authenticate using client ID only either. We're only using this library to display a feed of tagged images without any login required, so it's not really possible for me to store an access token in a secure way.. I don't believe it's considered safe to just generate a token with my own user and paste this in the js-file..?
<issue_comment>username_5: That's precisely what I did. It's definitely not ideal but the sandbox token has no permissions so I'm not sure if it's "unsafe" or just a pain in the ass. 

>
<issue_comment>username_6: Yes, I tried with the sandbox version with auth token as well, but I needed all pictures from a tag, which of course wouldn't work.
I'm not sure how the verification process works around this, but maybe it would be possible to create and verify a common user/client for use in instafeed.is? So that we all could use the same access token, but there's no content/images on the account?
<issue_comment>username_5: We’d slam into rate limits pretty fast if any substantive group of people started using it. If memory serves, we now get 500 requests/hour, which is fine for modest sites, but easily reachable with “crowd sourcing”.


>
<issue_comment>username_6: Ah, I see, that's too bad. Seems to me like instagram don't want us to show image feeds on other sites anymore.. Which also seems like a "shoot yourself in the foot" kind of thing to do...
<issue_comment>username_5: That’s 100% their intention. This move was entirely calculated with the goal of quashing “unapproved” glimpses of the Ig user experience.

>

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Amend CodeCov upload script 
username_0: This now relies on Bash and Powershell, which exist on the AppVeyor machine image and will be present on virtually all developer machines. This should make it easier to replicate the build locally, as there is no need to install python or the codedov python package.
<issue_comment>username_1: Thanks for contributing that!

Could you please look at linting errors: https://ci.appveyor.com/project/AppVeyor-Website/website/build/1.0.1530#L128
<issue_comment>username_0: Hi Feodor, I actually ran the linter locally and fixed everything up, but then forgot to commit it. ooops. Never mind, they're all fixed now ....
<issue_comment>username_1: Thank you!
<issue_comment>username_0: No worries :)

[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'xexio', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2020-07-09 08:53:31+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': "There's a way to use the Hugo page variables inside a literal block?

I have this in the header of the document:

```
---
title: Page test
author: me
email: lyhxr@example.com
orgname:  myself
---
```
And I have this in the body:
```
[source,bash]
....
# test {{% param orgname %}}
....
```
But this renders as:
```
# test {{% param orgname %}}
```
instead of:
```
# test myself
```", 'title': 'Use Hugo page variables inside literal block in AsciiDoctor', 'type': 'issue'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'xexio', 'comment_id': 660697954.0, 'datetime': '2020-07-19 19:46:10+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': "@bep Which is the other issue with the same problem? There's a workaround to solve this?", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'muenchhausen', 'comment_id': 662027469.0, 'datetime': '2020-07-21 18:20:12+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': 'Using `fileTwo.adoc` directly without include seems also not rendering correctly, right? 

There might be a workaround, if you use AsciiDoc variables - but the substitution might not work within source sections:

```
:orgname: myself

This is {orgname}.

[source,bash]
....
# test {orgname}.
....
```', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'xexio', 'comment_id': 662041747.0, 'datetime': '2020-07-21 18:48:04+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': 'If I access `fileTwo.adoc` directly works well.

The problem only happens with the include function. I can’t use AsciiDoc variables to solve this because I need some custom shortcodes.

Maybe we can take a look at the code where the shortcodes are processed @username_1 

Thanks for your help.', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'muenchhausen', 'comment_id': 663889813.0, 'datetime': '2020-07-25 19:05:18+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': 'You were right. It seems, that the Hugo replacement is done before AsciiDoc include. 

Please explain why you need this exactly. Personally I would try not to use Hugo metadata  in AsciiDoc sections, because these cannot be rendered e.g. in PDF or other output formats.

Therefore I usually try to create a minimal AsciiDoc file ìndex.adoc` or `_index.adoc` for encapsulating Hugo rendering. That file `includes` the documentation sections without any Hugo metadata. You can name `index.adoc` a kind of adapter. The advantage here is that you can reuse these sections for rendering in other output formats without any side effects. 

`index.adoc` - as kind of adapter for Hugo rendering:
```
---
title: Page test
orgname:  myself
---
:orgname: {{% param orgname %}}
include::fileTwo.adoc[]
```

`fileTwo.adoc` - this is pure AsciiDoc and can be also rendered in PDF:
```
[source,bash,subs=attributes+]
....
# test {orgname}.
....
```

I just found, that you can even use variables within AsciiDoc code blocks - see `subs=attributes+`. The AsciiDoc variable substitutions are very powerful.', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'xexio', 'comment_id': 663958914.0, 'datetime': '2020-07-26 08:35:28+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': '@username_1 I’m using this functionality to load values from toml files. But you’re right, with this approach this shortcodes are not going to be replaced in PDF :’(

I’m going to create some custom extensions.

I was looking in the documentation but I don’t find the way to pass custom extensions to AsciiDoctor when I using in combination with Hugo.

There’s a way to do that?', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'muenchhausen', 'comment_id': 663963028.0, 'datetime': '2020-07-26 09:15:48+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': 'You can directly set AsciiDoc variables using the [attributes](https://gohugo.io/content-management/formats/#external-helper-asciidoc) arguments in `config.toml`:
```
[markup.asciidocext]
    extensions = ...
    workingFolderCurrent = true
    [markup.asciidocext.attributes]
        orgname = "myself"
```

Doing that, you don't need Hugo metadata.', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'xexio', 'comment_id': 664654802.0, 'datetime': '2020-07-27 21:46:09+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': '@username_1 thanks, I’m going to use this approach.

One question not related to the issue. There’s a way to call custom extensions from hugo?', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}]
column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Use Hugo page variables inside literal block in AsciiDoctor
username_0: There's a way to use the Hugo page variables inside a literal block?

I have this in the header of the document:

```
---
title: Page test
author: me
email: me@me.com
orgname:  myself
---
```
And I have this in the body:
```
[source,bash]
....
# test {{% param orgname %}}
....
```
But this renders as:
```
# test {{% param orgname %}}
```
instead of:
```
# test myself
```
<issue_comment>username_0: @bep Which is the other issue with the same problem? There's a workaround to solve this?
<issue_comment>username_1: Using `fileTwo.adoc` directly without include seems also not rendering correctly, right? 

There might be a workaround, if you use AsciiDoc variables - but the substitution might not work within source sections:

```
:orgname: myself

This is {orgname}.

[source,bash]
....
# test {orgname}.
....
```
<issue_comment>username_0: If I access `fileTwo.adoc` directly works well.

The problem only happens with the include function. I can’t use AsciiDoc variables to solve this because I need some custom shortcodes.

Maybe we can take a look at the code where the shortcodes are processed @username_1 

Thanks for your help.
<issue_comment>username_1: You were right. It seems, that the Hugo replacement is done before AsciiDoc include. 

Please explain why you need this exactly. Personally I would try not to use Hugo metadata  in AsciiDoc sections, because these cannot be rendered e.g. in PDF or other output formats.

Therefore I usually try to create a minimal AsciiDoc file ìndex.adoc` or `_index.adoc` for encapsulating Hugo rendering. That file `includes` the documentation sections without any Hugo metadata. You can name `index.adoc` a kind of adapter. The advantage here is that you can reuse these sections for rendering in other output formats without any side effects. 

`index.adoc` - as kind of adapter for Hugo rendering:
```
---
title: Page test
orgname:  myself
---
:orgname: {{% param orgname %}}
include::fileTwo.adoc[]
```

`fileTwo.adoc` - this is pure AsciiDoc and can be also rendered in PDF:
```
[source,bash,subs=attributes+]
....
# test {orgname}.
....
```

I just found, that you can even use variables within AsciiDoc code blocks - see `subs=attributes+`. The AsciiDoc variable substitutions are very powerful.
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 I’m using this functionality to load values from toml files. But you’re right, with this approach this shortcodes are not going to be replaced in PDF :’(

I’m going to create some custom extensions.

I was looking in the documentation but I don’t find the way to pass custom extensions to AsciiDoctor when I using in combination with Hugo.

There’s a way to do that?
<issue_comment>username_1: You can directly set AsciiDoc variables using the [attributes](https://gohugo.io/content-management/formats/#external-helper-asciidoc) arguments in `config.toml`:
```
[markup.asciidocext]
    extensions = ...
    workingFolderCurrent = true
    [markup.asciidocext.attributes]
        orgname = "myself"
```

Doing that, you don't need Hugo metadata.
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 thanks, I’m going to use this approach.

One question not related to the issue. There’s a way to call custom extensions from hugo?

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: [tree widget] ordering of items
username_0: Was there discussion of sort ordering? Should we reverse sort by number of children, or sort alphabetically?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6052978/125523240-324c3420-7a5c-44c0-a553-125cb1427359.png)
<issue_comment>username_1: I made the change in cl/383953895 before I went on vacation to order the Vertical SVGs by a displayRank property and the rest by alphabetic name. And in there I noted that we should disable the ranking in website: https://github.com/datacommonsorg/website/blob/8a46c54b560e6be4f69d6e6eb3516e3518824e92/static/js/stat_var_hierarchy/stat_var_hierarchy.tsx#L125-L141

For non-vertical SVGs the ranking should be alphabetical by name, but the "Miscellaneous" under Energy is a special-case to rename the special "eia/Root". I'll send out a fix for that...
<issue_comment>username_1: The "Miscellanous" ordering is because it is a special eia/ thing, and for it "specialized_entity" was missing. I've sent out cl/384701501 to fix that.

I'm reassigning the bug to Jennifer to drop sorting in the website code for verticals, and instead rely on the cache order, controlled by displayName property.  It is now as follows:

```
        {                                                                        
          "id": "dc/g/Demographics",                                             
          "specializedEntity": "Demographics"                                    
        },                                                                       
        {                                                                        
          "id": "dc/g/Household",                                                
          "specializedEntity": "Household"                                       
        },                                                                       
        {                                                                        
          "id": "dc/g/Housing",                                                  
          "specializedEntity": "Housing"                                         
        },                                                                       
        {                                                                        
          "id": "dc/g/COVID-19",                                                 
          "specializedEntity": "COVID-19"                                        
        },                                                                       
        {                                                                        
          "id": "dc/g/Employment",                                               
          "specializedEntity": "Employment"                                      
        },                                                                       
        {                                                                        
          "id": "dc/g/Health",                                                   
          "specializedEntity": "Health"                                          
        },                                                                       
        {                                                                        
          "id": "dc/g/Climate",                                                  
          "specializedEntity": "Climate"                                         
        },                                                                       
        {                                                                        
          "id": "dc/g/Energy",                                                   
          "specializedEntity": "Energy"                                          
        },                                                                       
        {                                                                        
          "id": "dc/g/Crime",                                                    
          "specializedEntity": "Crime"                                           
        },                                                                       
        {                                                                        
          "id": "dc/g/Economics",                                                
          "specializedEntity": "Economics"                                       
        },                                                                       
        {                                                                        
          "id": "dc/g/Education",                                                
          "specializedEntity": "Education"                                       
        },                                                                       
        {                                                                        
          "id": "dc/g/MilitaryService",                                          
          "specializedEntity": "Military Service"                                
        },                                                                       
        {                                                                        
          "id": "dc/g/Uncategorized",                                            
          "specializedEntity": "Uncategorized"                                   
        }                                                                        
```<issue_closed>

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Add Ukrainian localization
username_0: This PR initialize Ukrainian translation and include all from `dev-1.17-uk.1` branch

What was done:
* Localize front page
* Localize heading and subheading URLs
    Close kubernetes-i18n-ukrainian#6
    Close kubernetes-i18n-ukrainian#11
* Uk translation for k8s basics
    Close kubernetes-i18n-ukrainian#9
* Uk localization homepage
    PR: kubernetes-i18n-ukrainian#102
* Buildable version of the Ukrainian website
* Adding localized content of the what-is-kubernetes.md
    Close kubernetes-i18n-ukrainian#12
* Localizing site strings in toml file
* Localizing tutorials
    Close kubernetes-i18n-ukrainian#32
* Localizing templates
* Localize glossary terms
    Close kubernetes-i18n-ukrainian#2
* Create glossary for UK contributors
    Close kubernetes-i18n-ukrainian#101


Co-authored-by: Anastasiya Kulyk <nastya.kulyk@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maksym Vlasov <username_0@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored-by: Oleg Butuzov <username_5@users.noreply.github.com>

After merge this PR to master feel free to remove `dev-1.17-uk.1` branch, we would like work into https://github.com/kubernetes-i18n-ukrainian/website organization.

Thanks!
<issue_comment>username_1: That [preview](https://deploy-preview-20020--kubernetes-io-master-staging.netlify.com/uk/) looks good @username_0!

The new localization needs at least 2 owners that speak Ukrainian well. Owners & reviewers must be members of the Kubernetes organization on GitHub.

It looks like this branch is close to being OK to merge. I saw a few nits: there are files in the branch still in English; the owners file does not look valid; and “Home” isn't localized in https://deploy-preview-20020--kubernetes-io-master-staging.netlify.com/uk/docs/home/

However, I have a different concern; this one is less technical and more legal.
/hold
because I think this approach warrants further discussion.

:warning: **Take care** about several people contributing to a fork and then proposing a merge to [k/website](https://github.com/kubernetes/website) :warning:

Accepting a commit into the fork does not mean that it is valid for this project. Prow checks for contributor license agreements; if the fork does not, then a merge from that fork may not be allowed. Maybe there's a case for revising those requirements but, as they stand, the requirement for a CLA is going to be an obstacle there.
<issue_comment>username_0: Sorry, what you mean? I don't see non-localized stuff in `/uk/docs/home` location.
![](http://i.piccy.info/i9/7254c5f6049aeaf9ad2bd7df7eac0de4/1585733173/209508/1370499/Screenshot_from_2020_04_01_12_21_51.png)


---

##### About legal stuff.
IMHO, is distracting and if see to many small and big OSS projects, they have no this limitation, because when someone contributing to repo, they automatically agree with `LICENSE` file/section in `README.md` when start contributing in project, but Kubernetes need explicit signing. Well, OK.

In this PR, we have contribution of me (@username_0), @username_3 and @username_5. We all signed CLA so for this PR is is not problem.

##### 5. 
In future, we can work with [k/website](https://github.com/kubernetes/website/) `master` from our individual forks and use `kubernetes-i18n-ukrainian` org only [as issue tracker](https://github.com/kubernetes-i18n-ukrainian/website/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+sort%3Aupdated-desc) for sync our team. Because in orig repos too much issues, labels and other stuff that produce too much overwhelm to regular contributor.

In other hand, if I can add Prow bot to fork, I do it. 

---

##### 6.
P.S. Also, @username_2 propose separate `OWNERS` file changes from this PR into new PR and than merge `OWNERS` into master. Because now we, formally, have no any reviewers or owners for this PR.  
In the same time [localization doc](https://kubernetes.io/docs/contribute/localization/) said that `OWNERS` file is part of min requirement content that introduced by this huge PR. 
Maybe you have any suggestions on it?
<issue_comment>username_2: I'll let @username_1 speak on this as well, but the OWNERS file should be submitted (and merged) before the actual content (available in the specific language).

Right now, the prow bot can't assign this PR to any Ukrainian native language speakers.
<issue_comment>username_1: Because there are concerns here, I'm going to discuss them with approvers and make sure there's clear consensus (possibly existing, possible it's new discussion) on the policy and how to apply it.
<issue_comment>username_3: @username_1 thanks for your comments!
Let me explain the issue with partially translated files. These are solely docs that refer to k8s features with links to the front page. We translated only the page title and short description to have them appear on the front page, in k8s features block. We thought to catch up with them after our localization effort is confirmed. If it's not ok to leave them this way, we can remove them for now.
<issue_comment>username_1: AIUI, for a minimum localization the left navigation on https://deploy-preview-20020--kubernetes-io-master-staging.netlify.com/uk/docs/setup/ should also be showing as localized.
<issue_comment>username_0: But in other languages is not localized

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Problem using direct links (live/prod only)
username_0: ### Intro

It "looks like" there is a bug in production with direct links/routing(?).

- only occurs on live/production sites
- no errors when running locally using yarn start
- also, all pages used as examples below work fine when accessing them through the site (start at landing page, then click-through using menu of in-site links)

### Reproducable Error A

1. Browse to https://pester.dev/docs/commands/Describe

Problem 1: no left side-bar
Problem 2: uppercase Describe is being lowercased

### Reproducable Error B

1. Browse to https://pester.dev/docs/contributing/introduction
2. Click on link "How to File an Issue"

Problem: 404 error

### Versions

Redux Toolkit uses v0.35 which also has the same problem.

Try browsing to this link https://redux-toolkit.js.org/api/getDefaultMiddleware. 

Ping @username_2
<issue_comment>username_1: Same error, the version is 2.0.0-alpha.40.
<issue_comment>username_2: Hmmm.  Agreed that something is definitely going on with that RTK link, but it seems like only a few pages are being affected.  I also tried it with a few Redux core docs pages like https://redux.js.org/api/combinereducers , and they seem to work okay.

If I open that link, I do see the left sidebar very briefly, and then it hides itself.
<issue_comment>username_0: ## Help Needed

I am no pro, especially when it comes to the server side of Docusaurus. Hopefully this is enough information for someone to chip in and help solve this problem ❤️
<issue_comment>username_3: 1. This redirect does your hosting provider. Accordingly, this is not a D2 problem.
2. Use URL with trailing slash only.

When you go to direct links, Docusaurus does not manage this (redirects, trailing slashes), this is a static site, so the requested URL is important here, these problems depends on hosting platforms you use.

Try installing this package locally https://www.npmjs.com/package/serve, build a website and run the `serve /build` command - everything will become clearer.
<issue_comment>username_0: Thanks for explaining this @username_3, I will invest the time to get make this clear/learn.

It would be great if this is indeed a hosting issue (Netlify in this case).
<issue_comment>username_0: :scream: https://community.netlify.com/t/my-url-paths-are-forced-into-lowercase/1659
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_3 thank you for helping us out here ❤️. Looking at this I guess the only real solution for Netlify users would be using **lowercase ids**.

I will do some testing and if I can confirm, will propose a documentation PR advizing users to use lowercase ids to prevent issues with e.g. Netflify.
<issue_comment>username_3: @username_0 although maybe this is still a D2 problem, since our blog entry looks similar - https://v2.docusaurus.io/blog/2018/04/30/How-I-Converted-Profilo-To-Docusaurus -> https://v2.docusaurus.io/blog/2018/04/30/how-i-converted-profilo-to-docusaurus/ (redirect by Netlify)

And it works OK. I will try to do something with this, in the end we need to "simple" bring back the doc sidebar. But my personal opinion is that this kind of problem is the responsibility of the end-user (and its hosting provider). I do not promise, but I will try to do a workaround for this. (after all, I'm not pro either :smile:)
<issue_comment>username_3: @username_0 I have created PR https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/pull/2235. This patch should show the doc sidebar when going to the wrong URL path.
<issue_comment>username_0: Copied from a Netlify notification email:


## Will this impact my SEO?

No. Forwarding traffic to a new domain extension using a 301 redirect is a proven technique that search engines are well aware of. Your inbound links will not be affected. Your search engine rankings will not be affected.<issue_closed>

<issue_comment>username_2: This is still somehow _not_ working right, at least on a specific PR branch.

This version, from [the PR that added .43](https://github.com/reduxjs/redux-toolkit/pull/369), works fine:

https://deploy-preview-369--redux-starter-kit-docs.netlify.com/api/getdefaultmiddleware/

I merged that PR to `master`, and then merged `master` into [a larger WIP PR with code changes](https://github.com/reduxjs/redux-toolkit/pull/352).  However, _that_ version does _not_ work okay even after I merged in .43:

<issue_comment>username_2: Scratch that last comment.

I just tried clearing the Netlify cache and forcing a redeploy, and _now_, finally, the PR 352 preview link looks correct:

https://deploy-preview-352--redux-starter-kit-docs.netlify.com/api/getdefaultmiddleware/

- Sidebar on left side even though we went straight to the page URL
- Page TOC on the right side
- Content is the correct width

So, I'm going to claim this is indeed good to go now.

Thanks for poking at this enough to fix things!
<issue_comment>username_0: Netlify users: **make sure to disable `PrettyURLs`** (as that will prevent lowercased URL redirects and added trailing slashes leading to 404s). See https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/issues/2394#issuecomment-599039072
